org.miloss.fgsms.plugins.federation

Interface FederationInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PluginCommon
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UddiPublisher

    public interface FederationInterface
extends PluginCommon
    Implementors provide the ability to publish summarized data from fgsms to an external system on a periodic basis. Non periodic federation publishers (such as a web service MUST also implement this interface. In this case, the Publish method does nothing. Constructor functions should be non blocking.
    Author:
    AO

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Publish(boolean pooled, QuickStatWrapper data, ServicePolicy sp, FederationPolicy fp)
      Called by a Quartz timer job
      boolean ValidateConfiguration(FederationPolicy fp, AtomicReference<String> outMessage)

      • Methods inherited from interface org.miloss.fgsms.plugins.PluginCommon

        GetAppliesTo, GetDisplayName, GetHtmlFormattedHelp, GetOptionalParameters, GetRequiredParameters

    • Method Detail

      • ValidateConfiguration

        boolean ValidateConfiguration(FederationPolicy fp,
                            AtomicReference<String> outMessage)
        This is called by both the user interface as well as whenever someone attempts to add or change a service policy containing this federation target.
        Parameters:
        fp - the proposed federation policy
        outMessage - returns the error message, if any. Null or empty string can be returned if there is no error. The message should be a human readable reason for why the policy is invalid or misconfigured.
        Returns:
        True if the configuration is valid, false otherwise

      • Publish

        void Publish(boolean pooled,
           QuickStatWrapper data,
           ServicePolicy sp,
           FederationPolicy fp)
        Called by a Quartz timer job
        Parameters:
        pooled - indicates where or not we are using pooled database connections
        data - represents the last known data set for a web service, availability info for all policy types
        sp - the complete service policy of the thing we are publishing
        fp - the federation policy, which should allow users to dictate implementation specific parameters and settings
        See Also:
        org.miloss.fgsms.common.Utility.GetConfigurationDBConnection
